attributes.action: Make petrol the same price across England
attributes.additional_details:
I live in Harlow Essex petrol is £1.56.9 per litre. In Epping its £1.53.9. Enfield North London 12 miles away at a BP garage it's £1.52.9. In Haverhill on the Suffork/Essex boarder it's £1.46.9. Why is it so different? 

There should be a standard price which is fair and equal for everyone despite Post Codes.  

In the middle of a cost of living crisis the devide is made bigger by greed.
attributes.background:
Equally priced petrol across the whole UK.

Force the petrol forecourts to sell petrol for the same price wherever they are in the UK.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for retailers.
